intro: Paraboea bettiana, commonly known as the white-flowered paraboea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Paraboea bettiana thrives in damp, shaded environments, often found in forest undergrowth.
